title: Glucosio: Diabetes Tracker
summary: Glucosio is a modern diabetes tracker
description: Glucosio is a modern diabetes app for blood glucose, HB1AC, Cholesterol, Blood Pressure, Ketones, Body Weight and more. Glucosio diabetes tracker makes it quick and easy to track all aspects of your diabetes! Glucosio is the only open source diabetes app for both type 1 & type 2 diabetes and entirely free!- Healthline's Top Best Diabetes Apps of 2017 for Android and iOS- Winner of Black Duck Software's Top Open Source Projects of 2015- Featured in June Edition of Diabetes Forecast Magazine FEATURES:• Quick and easy logging (blood glucose, HB1AC, Cholesterol, Blood Pressure, Ketones, Body Weight etc.)• Designed for both type 1 & type 2 diabetes• Estimated HbA1c & HbA1c conversion calculator• Choose Glucose Target (ADA, NICE, AACE, Custom)• Reminders;• Daily, weekly and monthly graphs and analysis• Assistant gives tips and more• Backup to Google Drive and export data to CSV• Import from CSV• Free support (average response time under 24 hours!)• Accesibility features• Opt-in to support diabetes research anonymously through the app• Support for Android 7.1 shortcuts;COMING SOON:• Reminders• Dexcom CGM support• Additional export formats• New backup providers• Bolus and Basal trackingPlease file any bugs, issues, or feature requests at:https://github.com/glucosio/androidVisit our website to learn more about the Glucosio Project and Glucosio Foundation:http://www.glucosio.org/
descriptionHTML:
Glucosio is a modern diabetes app for blood glucose, HB1AC, Cholesterol, Blood Pressure, Ketones, Body Weight and more. Glucosio diabetes tracker makes it quick and easy to track all aspects of your diabetes! Glucosio is the only open source diabetes app for both type 1 & type 2 diabetes and entirely free!

- Healthline's Top Best Diabetes Apps of 2017 for Android and iOS
- Winner of Black Duck Software's Top Open Source Projects of 2015
- Featured in June Edition of Diabetes Forecast Magazine

FEATURES:
• Quick and easy logging (blood glucose, HB1AC, Cholesterol, Blood Pressure, Ketones, Body Weight etc.)
• Designed for both type 1 & type 2 diabetes
• Estimated HbA1c & HbA1c conversion calculator
• Choose Glucose Target (ADA, NICE, AACE, Custom)
• Reminders;
• Daily, weekly and monthly graphs and analysis
• Assistant gives tips and more
• Backup to Google Drive and export data to CSV
• Import from CSV
• Free support (average response time under 24 hours!)
• Accesibility features
• Opt-in to support diabetes research anonymously through the app
• Support for Android 7.1 shortcuts;

COMING SOON:
• Reminders
• Dexcom CGM support
• Additional export formats
• New backup providers
• Bolus and Basal tracking


Please file any bugs, issues, or feature requests at:
https://github.com/glucosio/android


Visit our website to learn more about the Glucosio Project and Glucosio Foundation:
http://www.glucosio.org/
comments: After latest update (06-03-2017) lost all of my readings and history. Forced me to set up as new user. Lost several months of readings. Please fix. While I did have the datbase backed up..currently there is no way to import it back.

Simple, functional, and beautiful. It tracks a handful of your most important health metrics and keeps them all in one place. The graphs are great and the interface is intuitive. It doesn't do calorie/carb counting like a few of the other apps, but that's actually a big plus for me, since I use other apps to do that, and prefer an uncluttered interface for simple tracking.
Can't put in 4.3 a a result. Always says invalid number. Works for 4 or 5. Can't use this for mmol/L at all.

I'm new to diabetes.  I'm new to the App,  I've had it about 4 days now.  Can someone tell me what I'm doing wrong or is it the App?  I wish I could give this 5 stars.  I like everything about it but this problem below.  I use the weight data entry option.  Pretty simple, settings are on pounds and indicate pounds in the results.  But no matter what I enter it saves the numbers right in History but displays the graph results wrong by hundreds of pounds.     The entry cell for weight entries always reads exactly what I enter, then I save it the same way I do my glucose reading.  The Graph and History are not even close to what I entered.  My weight on the graph  goes from the 300's to the 100's one day after the next randomly.  That would imply I lost 200 pounds overnight.  I go into History and look at the entry and even edit it despite it being the number I originally entered.  When I edit it and save it, the saved number is +/- 5-7 pounds.  Then when I look at the graph it shows me in the 100 pound range.  I'm in the mid 200's.  Point is, none of the numbers match the entry.  Edited numbers always save wrong.  Does someone have a similar experience and or solution?
Very pleased with this app. Android user. One month of use. Wonderful app. Thank you!
It's really great, just couldn't give a 5star since graph sometimes drops to 0 on some days instead of going to next reading.
recentChanges: • Fixed issue with CSV export on some devices;
• Miscellaneous bug fixes and performance improvements;
